devanagari:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं
क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति ।
एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना
गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥ २१ ॥
transliteration:
te taṁ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṁ viśālaṁ
kṣīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśanti
evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannāḥ
gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante

synonyms.meaning: of the results of pious activities
the principles of the three Vedas

translation: When they have thus enjoyed vast heavenly pleasures, they return to the mortal world when their merit is exhausted. Thus, those who follow the Vedic rituals, desiring sense enjoyment, take repeated birth and death.
purport: One who is promoted to higher planetary systems enjoys a longer life and better sensual facilities, but they cannot remain there indefinitely. Once their accumulated piety is exhausted, they return to the earthly realm. Those who do not attain true knowledge of the Absolute Truth—Kṛṣṇa—are caught in the endless cycle of promotion and demotion, similar to a ferris wheel. They rise to heaven and fall again to earth. Such movement between higher and lower realms is ultimately unproductive for spiritual advancement. Instead, one should seek entry into the spiritual world, where life is eternal, full of bliss and knowledge, free from the miseries of birth and death.
